newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Aug Yugo inflation could ease to 3 pct - Institute.
newsitem.headline: Aug Yugo inflation could ease to 3 pct - Institute.

text.p: A group of leading Yugoslav economists on Thursday said government control in services prices could ease August inflation back to 3.0 percent.
The economists blamed a huge hike in the price of government services for boosting July inflation to what they saw as an alarming rate of 6.6 percent.
According to the Statistics Office, government services rose an average of 10.4 percent in July, aiding a surge above the previous month's 3.3-percent inflation rate.
"Therefore, we suggest that the government abstain from any further price increases in services," said Miroljub Labus, a chief economist at the Belgrade-based Economic Institute.
The Institute said the price of services, including those controlled by the state, climbed 114.2 percent from January to July.
In the same period, consumer prices rose by 28 percent and industrial goods by 26.7 percent. No separate figures were available for state-supplied services.

"(Monthly) inflation must not enter double digits. The government must try to keep the dinar exchange rate stable and retain both fiscal and monetary stability," said Jurij Bajec, another member of the Institute and a professor at the Belgrade School of Economics.
